channel.title: [EasyRSC] If banned how to login but send them to certain location
channel.description: Ok so instead of saying "Account disabled" I want it to log the user in (muted) to a certain location I setup for banned users (I already made it). How do I do this?

if(rank == 6) { player.mute = 1; // Mute the player player.getActionSender().sendMute(); player.teleport(x, y, false); // Teleport the player to a specific location }

However, you and I both know this isn’t the correct way to do it, so for the sake of your embarrassment and rage, lets not do it again.

item.title: [EasyRSC] If banned how to login but send them to certain location
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“Sworddude247, post:7, topic:348334”]I made the changes and when I compiled I get this exception:

[code]Buildfile: build.xml

compile:
[javac] Compiling 184 source files to C:\Users\Danny\Desktop\Private Server\NOOBscape_V3\NOOBscape V3\Server\build
[javac] C:\Users\Danny\Desktop\Private Server\NOOBscape_V3\NOOBscape V3\Server\src\org\rscdaemon\server\model\Player.java:1277: cannot find symbol
[javac] symbol : variable player
[javac] location: class org.rscdaemon.server.model.Player
[javac] player.mute = 1; // Mute the player
[javac] ^
[javac] C:\Users\Danny\Desktop\Private Server\NOOBscape_V3\NOOBscape V3\Server\src\org\rscdaemon\server\model\Player.java:1278: cannot find symbol
[javac] symbol : variable player
[javac] location: class org.rscdaemon.server.model.Player
[javac] player.getActionSender().sendMute();
[javac] ^
[javac] C:\Users\Danny\Desktop\Private Server\NOOBscape_V3\NOOBscape V3\Server\src\org\rscdaemon\server\model\Player.java:1279: cannot find symbol
[javac] symbol : variable player
[javac] location: class org.rscdaemon.server.model.Player
[javac] player.teleport(100, 100, true); // Teleport the player to a specific location
[javac] ^
[/code][/quote]

It looks to me that you’ve added your code in the player class. When the method you are trying to call upon is in the same class as where you are writing your code, you do not need the class name in front of the method name unless you defined a variable under the player class (Which I can tell you didn’t). So as long as you are in the player class you don’t need the bold player.getActionSender().sendMute(), a simple “getActionSender().sendMute()” or “this.getActionSender().sendMute()” will do.

Same thing goes for your teleport and the check that you have to see if player mute = 1.

Read full topic

item.title: [EasyRSC] If banned how to login but send them to certain location
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

As Mario said, in your PlayerLoader class, remove or comment out the part above, which will prevent a banned user from logging in. Then you will need to check upon login if the player is ‘banned’ or not. Easier way for you to do this is open your Player class, and find:

			int timeTillShutdown = world.getServer().timeTillShutdown();
			if(timeTillShutdown > -1) {
				sender.startShutdown((int)(timeTillShutdown / 1000));
			}

Above that, add something like:

			if(rank == 6) {
				player.mute = 1; // Mute the player
				player.getActionSender().sendMute();
				player.teleport(x, y, false); // Teleport the player to a specific location
			}

Totally untested, work with it and try mess with it yourself… If you still need more help, don’t hesitate to post back or PM me.

Read full topic
item.source: [EasyRSC] If banned how to login but send them to certain location

I haven’t ever seen looked at EasyRSC but you just need to look yourself man.

idiots.

You will have to delete this from playerLoader:

if (Integer.valueOf(props.getProperty("rank")) == 6) { fis.close(); return 6; // Banned. }

and you can make a new command that that mutes and teleports to certian area .
